intro: Silene odontopetala var. odontopetala, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and unique adaptations to its environment.
